API Contacts main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
main.read_root()¶
async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s initialize Redis caches.

Returns:

A fastapilimiter instance

Doc-author:

Trelent

API Contacts repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactCreate, user: User, db: AsyncSession) → Contact¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact for the user.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactCreate: Pass the request body to the function

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the logged in user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: AsyncSession) → Contact¶

The get_contact function returns a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be retrieved

  • user – User: Ensure that the user is only able to access contacts they have created

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object, which is the contact with the given id

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: AsyncSession) → List[Contact]¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the given user.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip a number of contacts in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: AsyncSession) → Contact | None¶

The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be removed

  • user – User: Identify the user that is making the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session object

Returns:

The contact that was removed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactUpdate, user: User, db: AsyncSession) → Contact | None¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactUpdate): A ContactUpdate object containing all fields that can be updated for a given user’s contacts.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be updated

  • body – ContactUpdate: Get the new values for the contact

  • user – User: Make sure that the user is only able to update their own contacts

  • db – AsyncSession: Create a database connection

Returns:

The updated contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_status_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactStatusUpdate, user: User, db: AsyncSession) → Contact | None¶

The update_status_contact function updates the status of a contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to update

  • body – ContactStatusUpdate: Get the value of done from the request body

  • user – User: Make sure that the user is authenticated and authorized to access this endpoint

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object if the contact is found, otherwise it returns none

Doc-author:

Trelent

API Contacts repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → None¶

The confirmed_email function is used to set the confirmed field of a user in the database to True. This function is called when a user clicks on an email confirmation link sent to them by the application.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user that is being confirmed

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Pass in the user model that is created from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession) → User¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Filter the user by email

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Get the user from the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of the parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

The update_password function updates the password of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • password – str | None: Set the password of a user

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

A user object

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user in the database

  • token – str | None: Specify that the token parameter can be a string or none

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

None

API Contacts routes Contacts¶

exception src.routes.contacts.SomeDuplicateEmailException¶

Bases: Exception

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactCreate, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

It takes an object of type ContactCreate as input and returns an object of type Contact. The user must be logged in to create a contact.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactCreate: Define the type of data that is expected to be passed in

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • current_user – User: Get the user that is currently logged in

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_birthday_contacts(days: int, skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_birthday_contacts function returns a list of contacts that have birthdays within the next X days.

Parameters:

  • days – int: Get the number of days from today to search for contacts

  • skip – int: Skip the first n contacts

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthday is in the next x days

Doc-author:

Trelent

The read_contact function is used to retrieve a single contact from the database. It takes in an integer representing the id of the contact and returns a Contact object.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to be updated

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contact object

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

async src.routes.contacts.search_contact_by_first_name(contact_email: str, skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The search_contact_by_first_name function searches for a contact by email.
The function takes in the following parameters:

  • contact_email (str): The email of the contact to search for.

  • skip (int): Number of contacts to skip before returning results. Default is 0, which returns all results starting from index 0.

  • limit (int): Maximum number of contacts to return per page, default is 100.

Parameters:

  • contact_email – str: Specify the email of the contact we want to search for

  • skip – int: Skip a number of records in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

The search_contact_by_last_name function searches for contacts by last name.

  • skip – int: Skip the first n contacts

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

It takes an id of the contact to update, and a body containing the fields to update. The function returns an updated Contact object.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactUpdate: Get the data from the request body

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

A contact object

async src.routes.contacts.update_status_contact(body: ContactStatusUpdate, contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_status_contact function updates the status of a contact.

The function takes in an id, body and db as parameters. It then calls the update_status_contact method from repository_contacts to update the status of a contact.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactStatusUpdate: Get the status of the contact from the request body

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact by id

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

The contact with the updated status

Doc-author:

Trelent

API Contacts routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. Then, it checks if that user exists in our database, and if they do not exist, returns an error message. If they do exist but their account has already been confirmed, we return a message saying so. Otherwise (if they are real and have not yet confirmed), we update their account status in our database.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A message that the email is already confirmed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.forget_password(background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, user: UserModel, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The forget_password function is used to send a reset password email to the user.
The function takes in the following parameters:

background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, user: UserModel, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)

Parameters:

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks

  • user – UserModel: Get the email from the user

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A message to the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes in the username and password of the user, verifies them against what’s stored in the database, and returns an access token if successful.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dict with the following keys:

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token. It takes in a refresh token and returns a new access token. The function first decodes the refresh_token to get the email of the user who owns it, then gets that user from the database and checks if their stored refresh_token matches what was passed in. If they don’t match, we update the users stored tokens with None (effectively logging them out) and raise an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED). If they do match, we create new tokens for this user using auth_service’s create functions

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the access token from the request header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

The same payload as the login function

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send a confirmation email to the user. It takes in an email address and sends a confirmation link to that address. The function also checks if the user has already confirmed their account, and returns an error message if they have.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A message to the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.reset_password(token: str, body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The reset_password function is used to reset a user’s password.

It takes in the token from the email sent to the user, and then uses that token to get their email address. The function then gets their username using that email address, and updates their password with a new one.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the email of the user who requested a password reset

  • body – UserModel: Get the user’s new password

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a background task to the queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with a user and detail key

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserModel object as input, which is validated by pydantic. If the email address already exists in the database, an HTTP 409 error is raised. The password field of the UserModel object is hashed using Argon2 and stored in that form. A new user record is created with this information and returned to the client.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the user and a detail message

Doc-author:

Trelent

API Contacts service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None) → str¶

The create_access_token function creates a new access token.

Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the claims to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional parameter specifying how long, in seconds, from now that this token should expire. If not specified, it will default to 15 minutes.

Returns:

str: A string with the encoded access token.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class variables

  • data – dict: Pass the claims to be encoded in the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Specify how long the token will be valid for

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes in a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is created using the JWT library, which encodes the data into a string that can be decoded later. The function adds an iat (issued at) key to the dictionary with its value being datetime.now(timezone.utc). It also adds an exp (expiration) key to the dictionary with its value being datetime now plus 7 days.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes and methods

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded into a jwt

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the user’s email address and a secret key

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the refresh token expires. Defaults to None, which sets it to 7 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time for the refresh token

Returns:

A refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if it’s valid. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass in the refresh token that was sent from the client

Returns:

The email of the user that is associated with the refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user if it’s valid, or raises an exception otherwise.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the class itself

  • token – str: Get the token from the request header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session, and the token: str parameter is used to pass in a jwt

Returns:

The user object that corresponds to the email in the jwt payload

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function uses the jwt library to decode the token, which is then used to return the email address.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token to the function

Returns:

The email address associated with the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass the password to be hashed into the function

Returns:

A hash of the password

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Store the password that is entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Check the password that is being passed in against the hashed password stored in the database

Returns:

A boolean value

Doc-author:

Trelent

API Contacts service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_confirm_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

Sends a confirmation email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.

The function takes the following parameters:

Args:

email (EmailStr): The user’s email address. This is used both as the recipient of the message and as part of token_verification. username (str): The username of the user who is registering. This is used to personalize the message. host (str): The host of the server. This is used to generate the confirmation link.

Returns:

None

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the user

  • username – str: Get the username of the user who is registering

  • host – str: Get the host of the server

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.services.email.send_reset_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

The send_reset_email function sends a password reset email to the user.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Validate the email address

  • username – str: Identify the user in the database

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to send_reset_email function

Returns:

A coroutine

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.services.email.send_update_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_update_email function sends an email to the user with a link to reset their password.
Args:

email (str): The user’s email address. username (str): The username of the account that needs its password reset. host (str): The hostname of the server where this function is being called from.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the recipient

  • username – str: Identify the user

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to

Returns:

A coroutine, which is an object that can be awaited
